metadata.name: Character Archetypes (Ancient Mythology Expansion)
metadata.description: Character types from ancient mythological traditions

cosmic_originators.text: The Primordial Pair whose union or separation creates the world
The Cosmic Weaver who spins the fabric of reality from primordial elements
The World Shaper who forms landscapes from their own body
The First Sacrifice whose dismemberment creates different realms
The Void Dweller who existed before creation and remains outside its laws

divine_mediators.text: The Fire Bringer who steals divine power to benefit humanity
The Divine Messenger who travels between realms with cosmic news
The Celestial Scribe who records the fates of gods and mortals
The Divine Child raised among mortals, unaware of their true nature
The Oath Keeper who enforces promises made between gods and humans

cosmic_challengers.text: The Divine Usurper who overthrows an established cosmic order
The Bound Power whose imprisonment maintains cosmic balance
The Chaos Bringer who disrupts order to enable new creation
The Cosmic Trickster whose pranks have world-altering consequences
The Elder Power who predates current gods and resents their dominance

fate_figures.text: The Destiny Weavers who spin, measure, and cut the threads of mortal lives
The Prophecy Speaker whose words inevitably come true despite attempts to avoid them
The Doom Assigner who determines how each person will meet their end
The Cosmic Judge who weighs souls against universal principles
The Fate Challenger who defies predetermined destiny

threshold_guardians.text: The Underworld Ferryman who transports souls across the boundary of death
The Gate Keeper who controls access to sacred or forbidden realms
The Trial Master who tests those seeking to enter divine spaces
The Dream Guardian who protects the boundary between waking and sleeping worlds
The Cosmic Hound who hunts those who transgress natural boundaries

divine_embodiments.text: The Dying and Rising God whose death and rebirth mirrors seasonal cycles
The Divine Twins representing complementary cosmic principles
The Triple Deity manifesting as maiden, mother, and crone (or youth, warrior, sage)
The Sacred Marriage Couple whose union ensures fertility and prosperity
The Divine Androgyne who transcends and unifies gender polarities

mortal_exemplars.text: The Culture Hero who brings civilization's gifts to humanity
The First Practitioner who discovers and teaches a crucial skill or art
The Monster Slayer who defeats primordial threats to human existence
The Divine Beloved whose beauty or virtue attracts immortal attention
The Hubristic Challenger who competes against gods with tragic results
